Description: Tripod-footed incense burner with perforated domed lid with a knob on the top; cast brass, decorated with silver and gold inlays, including a series of figures, some of whom hold Christian liturgical items including a cross and censer.
Curator's comments: The iconography indicates that this piece was made for a Christian patron.
Bibliographic references: Baer E 1983a / Metalwork in Medieval Islamic Art (pp.55-56, fig. 40)
Ward 1990/91 / Incense and incense burners in Mamluk Egypt and Syria (pp.76-79, pl.15)
Barrett 1949a / Islamic metalwork in the British Museum (pl.21)
Akbarnia et al 2018 / The Islamic World: a History in Objects (p.119, fig.2)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2001 22 Oct-2002 10 Mar, Paris, Institut du Monde Arabe, 'L'Orient de Saladin au temps des Ayyoubides' 1997 3 Mar-6 Jul, USA, New York, The Metropolitan Museum of Art, The Glory of Byzantium
